headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. The Fisheries--An American Fisherman Fired Into by a British Steamer. Boat Upset and Loss of Life at Albany. Electoral Vacancy Filled. General Scott on Slavery. Delegates to the Democratic State Convention. Webster Demonstration in Boston. Attempt to Abduct Seamen from an American Ship-Loss of Life. Man Run Over and Killed on the Western Railroad-Fire in Springfield, Mass. Track Washed away on Philadelphia, Wilmington and Baltimore Railroad. Murderer Convicted. Another Duel. The Cholera at Rochester.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Gloucestcr Telegraph of to-day, announces the arrival of the schooner Mary Niles, Captain POOL, from the Bay of St. Lawrence. Captain POOL states that he, with others, were driven out of the Bay of Chaleur by the steamship Devastation.
docs.snippet: The Gloucestcr Telegraph of to-day, announces the arrival of the schooner Mary Niles, Captain POOL, from the Bay of St. Lawrence. Captain POOL states that he, with others, were driven out of the Bay of Chaleur by the steamship Devastation.
